poem:
### The Pollster's Lament

Votes cast—vanish
like mist at dawn.

Prospects whispered
between ledger pages,
faltering breath of numbers.

Half the worth
of question,
half the truth
of answer.

Morning wake,
a graph redrawn,
fortunes scatter
in the soft hush
of broken promises.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "YouGov shares almost halve in value after sales and profits warning Shares in the polling company YouGov plunged by almost half on Thursday after the UK research and analytics company warned that sales and profits would be lower than expected this year. The firm, which is best known for its political polling but generates most of its revenues from providing consumer data and analysis to businesses, said sales bookings had been lower than anticipated since". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
